data.enText: bend into shape

data.chText: 使弯曲，使扭曲（成一定形状）
data.enText: to bend or turn sth into a particular shape
Twist the wire to form a circle.
to bend or turn sth into a shape or position that is not normal or natural; to be bent or turned in this way

data.chText: 他抓住我，把我的胳膊扭到背后。
data.enText: He grabbed me and twisted my arm behind my back.
Her face twisted in anger.
turn body
to turn part of your body around while the rest stays still
He twisted his head around to look at her.

data.chText: 我唤她的名字时，她坐在座椅上转过身来。
data.enText: She twisted in her chair when I called her name.
to turn your body with quick sharp movements and change direction often

data.chText: 我左躲右闪免得被捉住。
data.enText: I twisted and turned to avoid being caught.

data.chText: 她试图挣脱身子，但无济于事。
data.enText: She tried unsuccessfully to twist free.

data.chText: 他设法在有限的空间内转过身来。
data.enText: He managed to twist himself round in the restricted space.
turn with hand
to turn sth around in a circle with your hand

data.chText: 向左转动手柄把门打开。
data.enText: Twist the knob to the left to open the door.

data.chText: 我紧张地转动着手指上的戒指。
data.enText: Nervously I twisted the ring on my finger.
of roads/rivers
to bend and change direction often

data.chText: 道路沿着海滨蜿蜒曲折。
data.enText: The road twists and turns along the coast.
narrow twisting streets
a twisting staircase
ankle/wrist/knee
to injure part of your body, especially your ankle, wrist or knee, bending it in an awkward way
She fell and twisted her ankle.
wind around
to wind sth around or through an object

data.chText: 她用一条围巾裹住了头。
data.enText: She twisted a scarf around her head.
The telephone cable has got twisted (= wound around itself) .
to move or grow by winding around sth

data.chText: 一条蛇缠绕在他的手臂上。
data.enText: A snake was twisting around his arm.
facts
to deliberately change the meaning of what sb has said, or to present facts in a particular way, in order to benefit yourself or harm sb else

data.chText: 你总是歪曲我说的每一句话。
data.enText: You always twist everything I say.

data.chText: 这家报纸被指责歪曲事实。
data.enText: The newspaper was accused of twisting the facts.
threads
to turn or wind threads, etc. together to make sth longer or thicker

data.chText: 他们把床单绞成绳子，缘绳而下逃走了。
data.enText: They had twisted the sheets into a rope and escaped by climbing down it.
twist sb's arm

data.chText: 劝说；强迫；生拉硬拽；施加压力
data.enText: to persuade or force sb to do sth

data.id-g-sent: twist/wrap/wind sb round your little finger

data.enText: twist sth↔off
to turn and pull sth with your hand to remove it from sth
I twisted off the lid and looked inside.
a twist-off top
action of turning
the action of turning sth with your hand, or of turning a part of your body

data.chText: 她又拧了一下，盖儿开了。
data.enText: She gave the lid another twist and it came off.

data.chText: 他羞怯地笑了笑，略微扭了一下头。
data.enText: He gave a shy smile and a little twist of his head.
unexpected change

data.chText: （故事或情况的）转折，转变，突然变化
data.enText: an unexpected change or development in a story or situation

data.chText: 他政治生涯的一波三折
data.enText: the twists and turns of his political career
The story has taken another twist.

data.chText: 一名重要证人失踪，令诉讼出现了新的变数。
data.enText: The disappearance of a vital witness added a new twist to the case.

data.chText: 由于命运巧妙的安排，大约只过了一周我们又相逢了。
data.enText: By a curious twist of fate we met again only a week or so later.
in road/river
a sharp bend in a road or river

data.chText: 汽车沿着弯弯曲曲的山路行驶。
data.enText: The car followed the twists and turns of the mountain road.
shape

data.chText: 螺旋状的东西；卷曲物；捻合成的东西
data.enText: a thing that has been twisted into a particular shape

data.chText: 加了一片柠檬的矿泉水
data.enText: mineral water with a twist of lemon
dance

data.chText: 扭摆舞（盛行于20世纪60年代）
data.enText: a fast dance that was popular in the 1960s, in which you twist from side to side
round the bend/twist
crazy
She's gone completely round the twist.
get your knickers in a twist
to become angry, confused or upset

data.text: injure ♦ wound ♦ hurt ♦ bruise ♦ maim ♦ sprain ♦ pull ♦ twist ♦ strain

data.chText: 以上各词主要指在事故中伤害、使受伤。
data.enText: These words all mean to harm yourself or sb else physically, especially in an accident.
injure

data.chText: 尤指在事故中伤害、使受伤：
data.enText: to harm yourself or sb else physically, especially in an accident

data.chText: 他打曲棍球时膝盖受了伤。
data.enText: He injured his knee playing hockey.

data.chText: 撞车事故中有三人受伤。
data.enText: Three people were injured in the crash.
wound

data.chText: 指使身体受伤，尤指用武器伤害：
data.enText: [often passive] ( rather formal ) to injure part of the body, especially by making a hole in the skin using a weapon

data.chText: 这次袭击中有50人受重伤。
data.enText: 50 people were seriously wounded in the attack.

data.chText: wound常指在战争中或在波及许多人的其他袭击中受伤。
data.enText: Wound is often used to talk about people being hurt in war or in other attacks which affect a lot of people.
hurt
to cause physical pain to sb/yourself; to injure sb/yourself
Did you hurt yourself?

data.chText: 在事故中身体受伤可用hurt或injure，hurt强调引起的身体疼痛，injure强调身体部位受到某种程度的损伤。
data.enText: You can hurt or injure a part of the body in an accident. Hurt emphasizes the physical pain caused; injure emphasizes that the part of the body has been damaged in some way.
hurt or injure?
bruise

data.chText: 指摔伤、撞伤、（使）出现淤伤
data.enText: to make a blue, brown or purple mark (= a bruise) appear on the skin after sb has fallen or been hit; to develop a bruise
maim
( rather formal ) to injure sb seriously, causing permanent damage to their body
sprain
to injure part of your body, especially your ankle, wrist or knee, by suddenly bending it in an awkward way, causing pain and swelling
pull
to damage a muscle, etc., by using too much force
twist
to suddenly bend a part of your body, especially your ankle, wrist or knee, in an awkward way, causing an injury that involves pain and swelling

data.chText: sprain作名词表示踝、腕、膝扭伤引起疼痛或肿胀，作动词表示使踝、腕、膝扭伤；twist作动词表示扭伤踝、腕、膝。
data.enText: A sprain is an injury to your ankle, wrist or knee that causes pain and swelling; to sprain your ankle/wrist/knee is to injure it in this way. To twist your ankle/wrist/knee is to do the action (= to suddenly bend it in an awkward way) that causes the injury.
sprain or twist?
strain
to injure yourself or part of your body by making it work too hard

data.chText: 别在光线差的地方看书把眼睛给伤了。
data.enText: Don't strain your eyes by reading in poor light.
to injure/hurt/strain yourself
to injure/hurt/sprain/pull/strain a muscle
to injure/hurt/sprain/twist your ankle/foot/knee
to injure/hurt/sprain your wrist/hand
to injure/hurt/strain your back/shoulder/eyes
to injure/hurt your spine/neck
to be badly/seriously/severely/slightly injured/wounded/hurt/bruised/maimed/sprained
to be slightly injured/wounded/hurt/bruised/sprained
twist sb's arm

data.chText: 劝说；强迫；生拉硬拽；施加压力
data.enText: to persuade or force sb to do sth
turn/twist the knife (in the wound)

data.chText: 恶意地说（或做）；落井下石；往伤口上撒盐
data.enText: to say or do sth unkind deliberately; to make sb who is unhappy feel even more unhappy
twist/wrap/wind sb around your little finger

data.chText: 任意摆布某人；左右某人
data.enText: to persuade sb to do anything that you want
round the bend/twist
crazy
She's gone completely round the twist.
get your knickers in a twist
to become angry, confused or upset
twist sth↔off
to turn and pull sth with your hand to remove it from sth
I twisted off the lid and looked inside.
a twist-off top

tr: any clever maneuver
example: he would stoop to any device to win a point
it was a great sales gimmick
a cheap promotions gimmick for greedy businessmen

tr: the act of rotating rapidly
example: he gave the crank a spin
it broke off after much twisting

tr: turning or twisting around (in place)
example: with a quick twist of his head he surveyed the room

tr: the act of winding or twisting
example: he put the key in the old clock and gave it a good wind

tr: social dancing in which couples vigorously twist their hips and arms in time to the music
was popular in the 1960s
example: they liked to dance the twist

tr: a hairdo formed by braiding or twisting the hair
an interpretation of a text or action
example: they put an unsympathetic construction on his conduct

tr: a jerky pulling movement
an unforeseen development
example: events suddenly took an awkward turn

tr: a miniature whirlpool or whirlwind resulting when the current of a fluid doubles back on itself
a circular segment of a curve
example: a bend in the road
a crook in the path

tr: a sharp bend in a line produced when a line having a loop is pulled tight
a sharp strain on muscles or ligaments
example: the wrench to his knee occurred as he fell
he was sidelined with a hamstring pull

tr: twist suddenly so as to sprain
example: wrench one's ankle
The wrestler twisted his shoulder
the hikers sprained their ankles when they fell
I turned my ankle and couldn't walk for several days

tr: form into twists
example: Twist the strips of dough

tr: practice sophistry
change the meaning of or be vague about in order to mislead or deceive
example: Don't twist my words

tr: turn in the opposite direction
example: twist one's head

tr: form into a spiral shape
example: The cord is all twisted

tr: cause (a plastic object) to assume a crooked or angular form
example: bend the rod
twist the dough into a braid
the strong man could turn an iron bar

tr: twist or pull violently or suddenly, especially so as to remove (something) from that to which it is attached or from where it originates
example: wrench a window off its hinges
wrench oneself free from somebody's grip
a deep sigh was wrenched from his chest

tr: to move in a twisting or contorted motion, (especially when struggling)
example: The prisoner writhed in discomfort
The child tried to wriggle free from his aunt's embrace

tr: do the twist
extend in curves and turns
example: The road winds around the lake
the path twisted through the forest

value.def: If you twist something, you turn it to make a spiral shape, for example by turning the two ends of it in opposite directions.

example.ex: Her hands began to twist the handles of the bag she carried...
example.tran: 她双手开始捻弄手提包的拎带。

example.ex: Twist the string carefully around the second stem with the other hand...
example.tran: 用另外一只手小心地把细绳缠绕到第二根茎上。

example.ex: She twisted her hair into a bun and pinned it at the back of her head.
example.tran: 她把头发盘成一个髻，用发夹别在脑后。

value.def: If you twist something, especially a part of your body, or if it twists, it moves into an unusual, uncomfortable, or bent position, for example because of being hit or pushed, or because you are upset.

example.ex: He twisted her arms behind her back and clipped a pair of handcuffs on her wrists...
example.tran: 他把她的胳膊扭到背后，在她手腕上拷上一副手铐。

example.ex: Sophia's face twisted in pain...
example.tran: 索菲娅疼得脸都扭曲了。

example.ex: Her hands twisted in her lap…
example.tran: 她的手在膝头扭绞着。

example.ex: The body was twisted, its legs at an awkward angle...
example.tran: 尸体扭曲变形，双腿弯成别扭的角度。

example.ex: The car was left a mess of twisted metal.
example.tran: 车子成了一堆扭曲的金属。

value.tran: (使)(尤指身体部位)弯曲变形;(使)扭曲

value.def: If you twist part of your body such as your head or your shoulders, you turn that part while keeping the rest of your body still.

example.ex: She twisted her head sideways and looked towards the door...
example.tran: 她侧头朝门看去。

example.ex: Susan twisted round in her seat until she could see Graham and Sabrina behind her...
example.tran: 苏珊在座位上扭来扭去，直到她看见身后的格雷厄姆和萨布丽娜。

example.ex: Holding your arms straight out in front of you, twist to the right and left.
example.tran: 双臂向前平伸，接着转向身体左右两侧。

value.def: If you twist a part of your body such as your ankle or wrist, you injure it by turning it too sharply, or in an unusual direction.

example.ex: He fell and twisted his ankle...
example.tran: 他摔倒了，扭伤了脚踝。

example.ex: Rupert Moon is out of today's session with a twisted knee.
example.tran: 鲁珀特·穆恩扭伤了膝盖，无法参加今天的训练。

value.def: If you twist something, you turn it so that it moves around in a circular direction.

example.ex: She was staring down at her hands, twisting the ring on her finger...
example.tran: 她低头盯着双手，转动手指上的戒指。

example.ex: She twisted the handle and opened the door…
example.tran: 她转动门把手打开了门。

example.ex: Reaching up to a cupboard he takes out a jar and twists the lid off.
example.tran: 他伸手够到上面的碗橱，拿出一个罐子并把盖子旋开。

example.ex: The bag is resealed with a simple twist of the valve.
example.tran: 只需拧一下阀门，气囊就能重新密封。

value.def: If a road or river twists, it has a lot of sudden changes of direction in it.

example.ex: The roads twist round hairpin bends...
example.tran: 道路呈U字形蜿蜒曲折。

example.ex: The lane twists and turns between pleasant but unspectacular cottages.
example.tran: 小径在令人惬意而又毫不起眼的村舍间迂回曲折。

example.ex: It allows the train to maintain a constant speed through the twists and turns of existing track.
example.tran: 它使火车在通过现有轨道的弯曲处时得以保持恒定的车速。

value.def: If you say that someone has twisted something that you have said, you disapprove of them because they have repeated it in a way that changes its meaning, in order to harm you or benefit themselves.

example.ex: It's a shame the way that the media can twist your words and misrepresent you...
example.tran: 媒体歪曲他人言论、曲解他人意图的做法真是可耻。

example.ex: Even remarks that were quite innocent could be twisted to produce an unintended effect.
example.tran: 即便完全没有恶意的话都会被歪曲，以达到并非说话人本意的效果。

value.def: A twist in something is an unexpected and significant development.

example.ex: …the twists and turns of economic policy…
example.tran: 经济政策的一波三折

example.ex: The battle of the sexes also took a new twist...
example.tran: 两性之争也出现了新的变数。

example.ex: Roger Hardy of the BBC looks at this latest twist in the political crisis in Algeria…
example.tran: 英国广播公司的罗杰·哈迪就阿尔及利亚政治危机的这一最新转机作出解析。

example.ex: As so often happens, this little story has a twist in the tail.
example.tran: 正如经常发生的那样，这个小故事在结尾处出现了转折。

value.def: A twist is the shape that something has when it has been twisted.

example.ex: ...bunches of violets in twists of paper...
example.tran: 纸卷包裹的一束束紫罗兰

example.ex: A thin twist of smoke curled from the cottage's single chimney.
example.tran: 一缕盘旋的轻烟从农舍唯一的烟囱里缭绕升起。

value.def: The twist is a dance that was popular in the 1960's, in which you twist your body and move your hips in an energetic way.
If something happens by a twist of fate, it happens by chance, and it is strange, interesting, or unfortunate in some way.

example.ex: By a curious twist of fate, cricket was also my favourite sport...
example.tran: 让人感到惊奇的是，板球碰巧也是我最喜欢的运动。

example.ex: In a cruel twist of fate, Ann's husband Bill is also suffering from the disease.
example.tran: 造物弄人，安的丈夫比尔也患上了那种病。

xrse.def: to get your knickers in a twist
